alternative_parents.description: 3-hydroxylated C19 steroid hormones. They are known to favor the development of masculine characteristics. They also show profound effects on scalp and body hair in humans.
alternative_parents.name: Androgens and derivatives

alternative_parents.description: Steroids carrying a beta-hydroxyl group at the 3-position of the steroid backbone.
alternative_parents.name: 3-beta-hydroxysteroids

alternative_parents.description: 3beta-hydroxy steroids containing a double bond between positions 5 and 6.
alternative_parents.name: 3-beta-hydroxy delta-5-steroids

alternative_parents.description: Steroids containing a double bond between positions 5 and 6.
alternative_parents.name: Delta-5-steroids

alternative_parents.description: Organic compounds containing a trialkylamine group, characterized by exactly three alkyl groups bonded to the amino nitrogen.
alternative_parents.name: Trialkylamines

alternative_parents.description: Compounds containing a secondary alcohol functional group, with the general structure HOC(R)(R') (R,R'=alkyl, aryl).
alternative_parents.name: Secondary alcohols

alternative_parents.description: Organic compounds containing an aliphatic ring substituted with at least one hydroxyl group.
alternative_parents.name: Cyclic alcohols and derivatives

alternative_parents.description: Compounds containing a bond between carbon a pnictogen atom. Pnictogens are p-block element atoms that are in the group 15 of the periodic table.
alternative_parents.name: Organopnictogen compounds

alternative_parents.description: Organic salts that results from the reaction of hydrochloric acid with an organic base.
alternative_parents.name: Hydrochlorides

alternative_parents.description: Derivatives of hydrocarbons obtained by substituting one or more carbon atoms by an heteroatom. They contain at least one carbon atom and heteroatom.
alternative_parents.name: Hydrocarbon derivatives

class.description: Compounds based on the cyclopenta[a]phenanthrene carbon skeleton, partially or completely hydrogenated; there are usually methyl groups at C-10 and C-13, and often an alkyl group at C-17. By extension, one or more bond scissions, ring expansions and/or ring contractions of the skeleton may have occurred.
class.name: Steroids and steroid derivatives

description: This compound belongs to the class of organic compounds known as 25-azasteroids and derivatives. These are azasteroids where the carbon atom at position 25 is replaced by a nitrogen atom.

direct_parent.description: Azasteroids where the carbon atom at position 25 is replaced by a nitrogen atom.
direct_parent.name: 25-azasteroids and derivatives

kingdom.description: Compounds that contain at least one carbon atom, excluding isocyanide/cyanide and their non-hydrocarbyl derivatives, thiophosgene, carbon diselenide, carbon monosulfide, carbon disulfide, carbon subsulfide, carbon monoxide, carbon dioxide, Carbon suboxide, and dicarbon monoxide.
kingdom.name: Organic compounds

subclass.description: Steroid derivatives in which one carbon atom in the steroidal skeleton has been substituted with a nitrogen atom.
subclass.name: Azasteroids and derivatives

superclass.description: Fatty acids and their derivatives, and substances related biosynthetically or functionally to these compounds.
superclass.name: Lipids and lipid-like molecules
